lead_paragraph: DuBOIS--Howard T.,90, of Westwood, MA and formerly of NYC died peacefully on Friday, April 22, 2016 surrounded by his family in Westwood, MA. He was the beloved husband of Peggy K. DuBois of Westwood for the past 58 years. Howard was born in New York City. He attended Andover and graduated from MIT in 1946. After graduation he joined the Air Force and served in the Korean War. Howard was an executive at the former Trinity Plastics and Paper of New York for many years. He was an avid tennis player and enjoyed wintering in Longboat Key, FL. In his later years, Howard and Peggy moved to the Boston area to be closer to their daughter and grandchildren. In addition to his wife, he is survived by his children, Gail DuBois of Southborough, MA ; John DuBois of Miami, FL; a sister, Janine Blum of CA; his grandchildren, Lauren and Heather DuBois. A funeral service will be held on Saturday, May 7, at 10:30am at the First Church and Parish, 670 High Street, Dedham. Burial will be private and at the convenience of the family. There are no visiting hours. Memorial contributions may be sent in his memory to Brain Science Foundation, 146 Linden Street, Wellesley, MA 02482. Services are under the care of the Morris Funeral Home, 40 Main St., Southborough. (Morrisfuneralparlor.com) 1/3

headline.main: Paid Notice: Deaths  DUBOIS, HOWARD T.
